ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - python
  - channel_sources

about.description: Most logging systems tell you what happened in your application, whereas eliot also tells you why it happened. eliot is a Python logging system that outputs causal chains of actions: actions can spawn other actions, and eventually they either succeed or fail. The resulting logs tell you the story of what your software did: what happened, and what caused it.
about.summary: Action-tracing logging for Python: the logging library that tells you why it happened

about.summary: Action-tracing logging for Python: the logging library that tells you why it happened

name: eliot

about.description: Most logging systems tell you what happened in your application, whereas eliot also tells you why it happened. eliot is a Python logging system that outputs causal chains of actions: actions can spawn other actions, and eventually they either succeed or fail. The resulting logs tell you the story of what your software did: what happened, and what caused it.
about.summary: Action-tracing logging for Python: the logging library that tells you why it happened

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "eliot" %}
{% set version = "1.17.5" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 6b3b17c60d8cbb9285369b61601bc5554aad023a153fc7bccadb1538968ea767

build:
  number: 1
  skip: true  # [py<36]
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python
    - six
    - boltons
    - pyrsistent
    - zope.interface
    - aiocontextvars  # [py<37]

test:
  imports:
    - eliot

about:
  home: http://github.com/itamarst/eliot
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_family: Apache
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'Action-tracing logging for Python: the logging library that tells you why it happened'
  description: |
    Most logging systems tell you what happened in your application, whereas eliot also tells you why it happened. eliot is a Python logging system that outputs causal chains of actions: actions can spawn other actions, and eventually they either succeed or fail. The resulting logs tell you the story of what your software did: what happened, and what caused it.
  doc_url: http://eliot.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/itamarst/eliot

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - itamarst

about.description: Most logging systems tell you what happened in your application, whereas eliot also tells you why it happened. eliot is a Python logging system that outputs causal chains of actions: actions can spawn other actions, and eventually they either succeed or fail. The resulting logs tell you the story of what your software did: what happened, and what caused it.
about.summary: Action-tracing logging for Python: the logging library that tells you why it happened
